quaint_stock_seahorse_fetch: An open-source judging system designed for judges and judge advisors to evaluate teams and conduct award deliberations for the VEX Robotics Competition.
still_honest_koala_dance: You could join by clicking the invite link directly or pasting the link below and clicking "Join".
knotty_brave_nils_ascend: Please enter a Judges' Room URL
performance_awards_description: Based on robot performance in matches and skills challenges. Default order follows Qualifying Criteria precedence <AW1>. Drag to reorder if needed.
judged_awards_description: Determined by judges based on award criteria. Default order follows Qualifying Criteria precedence <AW2>. Drag to reorder if needed.
volunteer_nominated_awards_description: Determined by volunteer staff and not by Judges. Sportsmanship Award and Energy Award can be dragged to this section.
upload_csv_again: Please upload a CSV file from RobotEvents or Tournament Manager
upload_csv_first: Please upload a CSV file first
event_name_whitespace_error_message: Event name must not have leading or trailing whitespace
event_name_too_long_error_message: Event name must be 100 characters or less
team_import_description: Import teams using CSV files from RobotEvents or Tournament Manager.
download_csv_from_robotevents: Download CSV from RobotEvents: Event Admin → "Downloads & Links" → "Download Tournament Manager Import Data"
download_csv_from_tournament_manager: Download CSV from Tournament Manager: File → Export → "Team List for Event"
award_name_whitespace_error_message: Award name must not have leading or trailing whitespace
award_name_too_long_error_message: Award name must be 100 characters or less
at_least_one_grade_level_must_be_selecte: At least one grade level must be selected
number_of_winners_must_be_greater_than_0: Number of winners must be greater than 0
number_of_winners_must_be_10000_or_less: Number of winners must be 10,000 or less
require_notebook_option_description: Check if this award requires teams to have a notebook
require_team_interview_option_descriptio: Check if this award requires teams to have completed a team interview
no_divisions_found_in_robotevents_messag: No divisions found in RobotEvents. Please select a division manually.
error_getting_event_teams_in_division: Error Getting Event Teams in Division
event_code_setup_description: If your event is listed on RobotEvents.com, enter the event code below which can be found in the event page on RobotEvents.com.
event_code_setup_description_2: Judges' Room will automatically import many settings for your event. In addition, please enable the feature to publish live results to RobotEvents in the Web Publish Setup page of Tournament Manager. This way, Judges' Room can automatically calculate the team eligibility for Excellence Awards and Think Award based on the latest rankings and skills scores.
event_code_setup_description_3: If your event will have two or more divisions:
event_code_setup_description_4: Please use Tournament Manager to set the division for each team and publish the division results to RobotEvents first. Judges' Room needs to know which teams belong to which division before it starts.
event_code_setup_description_5: Each Judges' Room can only be used for one division. Please use a second computer, another browser or incognito mode to create another Judges' Room for the second division.
event_code_setup_description_6: Judges' Room can only calculate Excellence Award(s) for its own division (division specific). If your event has event wide Excellence Award(s), please refer to the "Excellence Award Eligibility" reports from the Reports tab in Tournament Manager.
official_event_description: Connect to RobotEvents and determine the team eligibility based on the live results.
delete_judge_group_message: Are you sure you want to delete this judge group? If this judge group has been used for judging, all related rubrics and award rankings will be lost forever. This action cannot be undone.
remove_judge_message: Are you sure you want to remove this judge? If this judge submitted any rubrics, they will be lost forever.
walk_in_judging_description: Teams queue up and are assigned to judge groups randomly.
pre_assigned_judging_description: Teams are pre-assigned to specific judge groups. Judges find their assigned teams in their team pits for interviews.
all_active_teams_assigned_to_judge_group: All active teams are assigned to judge groups
drag_and_drop_teams_description: Drag and drop teams from here to judge groups. Right-click to select multiple teams.
all_teams_assigned_to_judge_groups: All teams are assigned to judge groups
please_create_at_least_one_judge_group: Please create at least one judge group to continue.
please_assign_all_active_teams: Please assign all active teams to judge groups to continue.
review_license_description1: This software is licensed under the GNU General Public License v3 (GPLv3). Join our
help_us_improve_judgesroom_com: Help us improve judgesroom.com by sharing anonymous usage data. This includes metrics like number of teams, judges, and devices. No judging content or personal information is collected. See our
how_do_you_want_to_import_from_roboteven: How do you want to import from RobotEvents?
import_teams_description: Import team list only. Existing teams not in the import will be removed along with their judging data. Teams with matching numbers will preserve their existing data.
import_full_setup_description: Import both teams and awards. The award list will be reset and you'll need to reconfigure custom awards. Awards with matching names will preserve their rankings.
organize_teams_description: Drag and drop teams between groups to organize them. Right click to select multiple teams. Team groups are useful when determining the final ranking of award winners.
no_teams_available: No teams available. Please import teams in the previous step.
choose_your_identity_to_start_participat: Choose your identity to start participating in the Judges' Room. You can change your role at any time later if needed.
evaluate_teams_and_participate_in_scorin: Evaluate teams and participate in scoring
manage_the_judges_room_and_oversee_judge: Manage the Judges' Room and oversee judges
no_judges_have_been_set_up_yet: No judges have been set up yet.
you_can_add_your_name_instead: You can add your name instead.
as_a_judge_advisor_you_can: As a Judge Advisor, you can manage the Judges' Room, oversee all judges, and access all judging data.
help_us_improve_judgesroom_com_short: Help us improve judgesroom.com by sharing anonymous usage data. No judging content or personal information is collected.
award_nominations_description: After judge groups complete their team interviews, each group selects their top one or two candidates from their interviewed teams for each award. Judge groups should share their nominations to create a shortlist for each award. When there are many nominations, the Judge Advisor may ask groups to withdraw weaker candidates based on brief arguments comparing the merits of each nomination against award criteria.
excellence_award_winners_are_selected_fr: Excellence Award winners are selected from Design Award finalists. Nominate teams for each award first, then go to
award_candidate_ranking_description: Click on any ranking cell, then use the minus (-) and plus (+) buttons to adjust stars, this indicates teams that are strong candidates for awards. In award deliberations, all judge groups will cross-reference their lists to create a final award nomination list. This table is shared and synchronized within your judge group - all judges see updates in real-time without having to refresh the page.
copy_this_report_to_share_the_award_winn: Copy this report to share the award winners.
award_winner_tab_description: The Judge Advisor should enter all award winners below for final confirmation. Before the award ceremony, the Judge Advisor should enter the result to the Tournament Manager.
award_winner_tab_performance_awards_desc: Performance Awards are based on robot performance on the competition field in match play and Skills Challenges. These awards do not impact a team's eligibility to earn a Judged Award.
no_performance_awards_configured_for_thi: No performance awards configured for this event.
award_winner_tab_volunteer_nominated_awa: Volunteer Nominated Awards are a subset of Judged Awards that can be determined by event staff (such as Head Referees, scorekeepers, and emcees) based on observations during the event. These awards, particularly Sportsmanship and Energy Awards, may be determined by volunteer nominations instead of judges. If determined solely by volunteers, teams can still receive these awards even if they've already earned another Judged Award.
award_winner_tab_summary_of_award_winner: This summary shows all award winners organized by team group.
please_enter_a_valid_url_for_the_noteboo: Please enter a valid URL for the notebook link
failed_to_save_team_data_please_try_agai: Failed to save team data. Please try again.
enter_the_url_to_the_team_s_engineering_: Enter the URL to the team's engineering notebook
failed_to_get_event_from_robotevents: Failed to get event from RobotEvents
excellence_award_candidates_description1: The Excellence Award Candidates tab shows the teams that are eligible for the Excellence Award.
excellence_award_candidates_description2: For events with a single Excellence Award, percentages are based on the number of teams at the event. For blended grade level events with two grade specific Excellence Awards, percentages are based on the teams in each grade level for each award. Please double-check the type of event. The Judge Advisor can configure the number of Excellence Award winners by clicking the top right menu and selecting "Change Event Setup".
excellence_award_candidates_description3: For most of the events, all teams are in the same default division: Division 1. If your event has multiple divisions, Judges' Room can only calculate Excellence Award(s) for its own division (division specific). If your event has event wide Excellence Award(s), please refer to the "Excellence Award Eligibility" reports from the Reports tab in Tournament Manager.
excellence_award_candidates_description4: Please refer to Guide to Judging for more details regarding the key criteria of the Excellence Award. It is also recommended to use the "Excellence Award Eligibility" reports to verify the results.
excellence_award_candidates_description5: Eligible teams are highlighted in green.
excellence_award_candidates_description6: There are {teamsInGroupCount} teams in the {acceptedGrade} grade level in Division {divisionId}. At the conclusion of Qualification Matches, teams must be ranked in the top 40% of teams in this group in Qualification Match rankings. This is calculated by {teamsInGroupCount} * 40% = {rankingEligibilityIntermediate} rounded to {rankingEligibilityThreshold} teams.
excellence_award_candidates_description7: There are {joinedTeamsInEventCount} teams in the {acceptedGrade} grade level at the event. This is the number of teams that actually arrived and participated in Qualification Matches. At the conclusion of the Robot Skills Challenge matches, teams must be ranked in the top 40% of all {award.acceptedGrades[0]} teams at the event. This is calculated by {joinedTeamsInEventCount} * 40% = {skillsEligibilityIntermediate} rounded to {skillsEligibilityThreshold} teams.
excellence_award_candidates_description8: At the conclusion of the Autonomous Coding Skills Challenge matches, teams must be with a score above 0 and ranked in the top 40% of all {award.acceptedGrades[0]} teams at the event. This is calculated by {joinedTeamsInEventCount} * 40% = {skillsEligibilityIntermediate} rounded to {skillsEligibilityThreshold} teams.
excellence_award_candidates_description9: There are {teamsInGroupCount} teams in all grade levels in Division {divisionId}. At the conclusion of Qualification Matches, teams must be ranked in the top 40% of teams in this group in Qualification Match rankings. This is calculated by {teamsInGroupCount} * 40% = {rankingEligibilityIntermediate} rounded to {rankingEligibilityThreshold} teams.
excellence_award_candidates_description1: There are {joinedTeamsInEventCount} teams in all grade levels at the event. This is the number of teams that actually arrived and participated in Qualification Matches. At the conclusion of the Robot Skills Challenge matches, teams must be ranked in the top 40% of all teams at the event. This is calculated by {joinedTeamsInEventCount} * 40% = {skillsEligibilityIntermediate} rounded to {skillsEligibilityThreshold} teams.

At the conclusion of the Autonomous Coding Skills Challenge matches, teams must be with a score above 0 and ranked in the top 40% of all teams at the event. This is calculated by {joinedTeamsInEventCount} * 40% = {skillsEligibilityIntermediate} rounded to {skillsEligibilityThreshold} teams.
no_teams_are_eligible_for_this_award: No teams are eligible for this award. It should not be given out at the event.
failed_to_get_excellence_award_eligibili: Failed to get Excellence Award eligibility data from RobotEvents
final_ranking_description1: Create the final ranking of award winners from nominated teams. After follow-up interviews are completed, judges who conducted those interviews should deliberate and rank nominees for each award. It's best practice to have first-choice winners plus three or more alternate candidates. Drag and drop teams to reorder nominations.
final_ranking_description2: Excellence Award winners are selected from Design Award finalists who also meet Performance Award criteria, which may result in reshuffling other award winners to maintain the one-judged-award-per-team rule. Drag team(s) from the Design Award column to the Excellence Award column(s) to designate Excellence Award winner(s).
final_ranking_description3: Teams in Excellence Award and Design Award columns display eligibility indicators in the top-right corner: <green>≤40%</green> (green) indicates the team meets the performance criteria (top 40% in qualification rankings, robot skills, and autonomous coding skills), <red>>40%</red> (red) indicates they do not meet the criteria.
final_ranking_description4: Teams in Think Award column display eligibility indicators in the top-right corner: <green>AUTO✓</green> (green) indicates the team participated in the Autonomous Coding Skills Challenge with a score greater than zero, <red>AUTO✗</red> (red) indicates they do not meet this criteria.
final_ranking_description5: Please make sure to enable the feature to publish live results to RobotEvents in the Web Publish Setup page of Tournament Manager. Click "Refresh from RobotEvents" to update the eligibility status.
final_ranking_description6: This Judges' Room failed to fetch the eligibility data from RobotEvents. Please check the Internet connection and try again.
final_ranking_description7: This Judges' Room is not connected to RobotEvents. To enable eligibility checking, please configure the RobotEvents Event ID and Division ID in Event Setup.
final_ranking_description8: Winning teams for each award are marked with a colored border: <green>green</green> for eligible winners, <red>red</red> for ineligible winners, and <slate>gray</slate> when eligibility data is unavailable.
judges_room_not_connected_to_robotevents: This tool helps judges and judge advisors to identify the candidates for Excellence Awards by fetching the latest rankings and skills scores from RobotEvents. However, this Judges' Room is not connected to RobotEvents.

match.notFoundCount=0: Successfully updated notebook links for {count} teams
match.notFoundCount=*: Successfully updated notebook links for {count} teams. {notFoundCount} teams were not found in the current event.

notebook_links_import_error: No teams were found matching the Excel data
notebook_sorting_description1: Judges perform a quick scan of all the Engineering Notebooks and divide them into three categories: Not Submitted, Developing, and Fully Developed. If it is unclear whether a notebook should be categorized as Developing or Fully Developed, either another Judge can help make that determination or the notebook should be given the benefit of the doubt and categorized as Fully Developed.
notebook_sorting_description2: Only Fully Developed notebooks will be able to start the Engineering Notebook Rubric.
notebook_sorting_import_title: Import Digital Engineering Notebook Links report
notebook_sorting_import_description1: If Engineering Notebooks are submitted digitally, please ask the Event Partner to provide digital notebook links report. This report can be downloaded from RobotEvents → Event Admin → "Downloads & Links" → "Download Digital Engineering Notebook Links report". Import the Excel file to this Judges' Room to set notebook links for teams in your event.
only_show_assigned_teams_for_your_curren: Only show assigned teams for your current judge group ({name})
no_teams_assigned_to_your_judge_group: No teams are assigned to your judge group.
failed_to_update_innovate_award_submissi: Failed to update innovate award submission form
start_award_deliberation_message: This will unlock award deliberation functions for all judges for the last step in the judging process. Rubrics can still be submitted. Please confirm to proceed.
award_deliberation_started: Award deliberation started! All judges can now access award deliberation functions.
start_award_deliberation_description: Begin the the last step of judging
excellence_award_candidates_description: Check the eligibility of each team
open_qr_code_dialog: Open a dialog with a QR code for the link
manual_attendance_changes_disabled_for_r: Manual attendance changes are disabled for RobotEvents integrated events. Use the sync button to update from RobotEvents.
no_team_rankings_found: No team rankings found. Please check-in teams in Tournament Manager and generate the match schedule first.
found_teams_with_rankings_some_attendanc: Found {count} teams with rankings. Some attendance differences detected.
found_teams_with_rankings_attendance_syn: Found {count} teams with rankings. Attendance is synchronized.
failed_to_fetch_attendance_from_roboteve: Failed to fetch attendance from RobotEvents: {error}
team_attendance_description_robotevents_: Manage the team attendance is important for the later stages of the judging process. This Judges' Room is connected to RobotEvents. Click the "Refresh from RobotEvents" button to update the team attendance. Please make sure to enable the feature to publish live results to RobotEvents in the Web Publish Setup page of Tournament Manager.
team_attendance_description_manual: Manage the team attendance is important for the later stages of the judging process. Click the top right button of a team to mark it as present or absent.
some_teams_have_different_attendance_sta: Some teams have different attendance status between the judging system and RobotEvents. Teams with flashing borders show the differences.
destroy_judging_data_description: Prior to the award ceremony, the Judge Advisor should secure the Judges' Room and destroy all judging materials. These items are not to be given to the Event Partner for destruction.
destroy_judging_data_description_warning: This action will permanently destroy all judging data including team evaluations, rankings, and notes. Make sure all connected devices have completed judging and all data has been properly collected before proceeding.
destroy_judging_data_confirmation: Type 'destroy' below to confirm the permanent destruction of all judging data.
choose_your_new_identity_for_the_judges_: Choose your new identity for the Judges' Room.
send_the_link_to_other_judges_to_invite_: Send the link to other judges to invite them to join
or_have_them_scan_the_qr_code_with_their: Or have them scan the QR code with their phone camera
all_participants_will_see_real_time_upda: All participants will see real-time updates
you_are_disconnected_from_the_server: You are disconnected from the server. This may be due to a network issue.
are_you_sure_you_want_to_leave_the_judge: Are you sure you want to leave the Judges' Room? You will lose connection to other judges.
this_action_is_available_for_judge_advis: This action is available for Judge Advisors only.
are_you_sure_you_want_to_modify_the_even: Are you sure you want to modify the event setup? This could disrupt ongoing judging activities.
you_have_unsaved_changes: You have unsaved changes. Are you sure you want to close this tab?
failed_to_reconnect_to_judges_room: Failed to reconnect to Judges' Room: {error}
you_have_been_kicked_from_the_judges_roo: You have been kicked from the Judges' Room
the_judges_room_has_been_destroyed: The Judges' Room has been destroyed
